original_solution_mapping.L1: When Jerry reads 30 pages on Saturday, he would be remaining with 93-30 = <<93-30=63>>63 pages.
original_solution_mapping.L2: After reading an additional 20 pages on Sunday, he would be remaining with 63 - 20 = <<63-20=43>>43 pages.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3235.
    Returns: the number of pages remaining before Jerry can finish the book.
    """
    # L1
    total_pages = 93 # The book has 93 pages
    pages_read_saturday = 30 # On Saturday, he reads 30 pages
    remaining_after_saturday = total_pages - pages_read_saturday

    # L2
    pages_read_sunday = 20 # reads 20 pages of the book
    remaining_after_sunday = remaining_after_saturday - pages_read_sunday

    # FA
    answer = remaining_after_sunday
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: When Jerry reads {pages_read_saturday} pages on Saturday, he would be remaining with {total_pages}-{pages_read_saturday} = <<{total_pages}-{pages_read_saturday}={remaining_after_saturday}>>{remaining_after_saturday} pages.

After reading an additional {pages_read_sunday} pages on Sunday, he would be remaining with {remaining_after_saturday} - {pages_read_sunday} = <<{remaining_after_saturday}-{pages_read_sunday}={remaining_after_sunday}>>{remaining_after_sunday} pages.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: When Jerry reads 30 pages on Saturday, he would be remaining with 93-30 = <<93-30=123>>123 pages.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: After reading an additional 20 pages on Sunday, he would be remaining with 123 - 20 = <<123-20=103>>103 pages.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '-' but used '+' instead.
